title: Art + Science: Cover It in Gold (October 29)
title_display: Art + Science: Cover It in Gold
short_description: Try your hand at the 8,000-year-old technique of gilding as you learn about the materials, tools, and steps involved in this process.
list_description: Try your hand at the 8,000-year-old technique of gilding as you learn about the materials, tools, and steps involved in this process.
description:
Across time and cultures, artists and artisans have used a process is called gilding, where thin layers of gold leaf are applied to their creations in order to add beauty and opulence. Guided by museum frame builder and conservation technician Chris Brooks, try your hand at the 8,000-year-old technique of gilding and learn about the materials, tools, and steps involved in this process.

About the Conservator

Christopher Brooks works in the Department of Conservation and Science as a technician. He is part of a small team responsible for treatment and care of painting frames in our collection.

This program is based upon work supported by the National Science Foundation under Grant No. OISE 1743748.
buy_button_caption: This free, drop-in program is open to all ages.
